Menko Luhut: Ekspor Nikel Dilanjutkan Jika Memenuhi Aturan Yang Berlaku
07 Nov 2019, 22:48 by Indra Virgiantara


Menko Luhut: Ekspor Nikel Dilanjutkan Jika Memenuhi Aturan Yang Berlaku

KBRN, Jakarta : Menteri Koordinator Bidang Kemaritiman dan Investasi Luhut B. Pandjaitan menyatakan bahwa pemerintah telah menindaklanjuti ekspor biji nikel yang belum lama ini dihentikan sementara. Menurutnya ekspor boleh dilakukan, namun harus sesuai dengan peraturan dan ketentuan yang berlaku.“Sekarang posisinya (ekspor biji nikel) sedang dirapatkan oleh Pak Bahlil (Kepala BKPM), tetapi kira-kira jika semua sudah memenuhi ketentuan itu akan dilepas. Sebagian sudah selesai. Kira-kira begitu (sudah boleh ekspor). Saya tidak tahu detailnya, Pak Bahlil nanti biar yang ngomong,” kata Menko Luhut saat ditemui media di Kantor Maritim dan Investasi, Kamis (7/11/2019).Ketika ditanya mengapa di bawah kewenangan Kepala BKPM Bahlil Lahadalia, Menko Luhut menegaskan bahwa “Kan dia wakil saya dalam investasi,” singkatnya.Untuk masalah ini Menko Luhut memaparkan, pihaknya juga bekerja sama dengan Komisi Pemberantas Korupsi (KPK). Hal itu sesuai dengan apa yang diperintahkan oleh Presiden Jokowi, dalam menertibkan proses investasi di Indonesia.“KPK, sesuai perintah Presiden, kita ajak untuk menertibkan semua proses-proses investasi di Indonesia yang jumlahnya, seperti ditulis oleh The Jakarta Post kira-kira 80M lebih angkanya. Jadi banyak sekarang investasi yang sudah siap, tetapi terhambat berbagai masalah, kadang - kadang terhambat sampai 3-4 tahun. Presiden memerintahkan saya agar segera dituntaskan, dan saya berharap itu bisa segera diselesaikan,” jelasnya.Selain itu, lanjut Menko Luhut, perlu juga Peraturan Menteri (Permen) dari Kementerian ESDM, perlu dilakukan revisi supaya tidak bertentangan dengan undang-undang. Adapun revisi terkait apa yang boleh dan tidak boleh dalam ekspor.“Saya sudah lapor Presiden tadi ada sekitar 3-4 pemain nikel yang sudah punya turunan sampai bawah, tadi kita rapat buat evaluasi supaya bisa terintegrasi antara satu bahan misalnya nikel dengan copper concentrate, sehingga punya nilai tambah yang makin banyak buat negeri kita. Karena misalnya gini, Freeport itu kita temukan turunannya itu, turunan daripada copper concentrate itu bisa 10-15 kali nilai tambah. Tadi saya lapor Presiden untuk membuat industri terpadu untuk itu,” ujarnya.“Nah itu sekarang sudah jalan, jadi tinggal kita lihat smelter dari Freeport itu tidak hanya di Gresik, tapi mungkin nanti di Morowali atau Weda Bay, sehingga Freeport nanti aman. NTB itu jadi ngirim dia punya produksi sampai 500 ribu ton masuk ke sana. Sehingga dari smelting nanti produk turunannya bisa dikerja samakan. Di samping itu kita juga kita mendapatkan mother machine, itu ibunya mesin, yang membuat alat-alat mesin. Indonesia belum punya, kita tidak perlu mengimpor lagi mesin, karena kita bisa buat mesin mungkin sampai pada mesin mobil, perkakas, dsb,” pungkasnya.

Coordinating Minister Luhut: Nickel Export Continued If Fulfilling Applicable Regulations
Nov 7 2019, 22:48 by Indra Virgiantara


Coordinating Minister Luhut: Nickel Export Continued If Fulfilling Applicable Regulations

KBRN, Jakarta: Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs and Investment Luhut B. Pandjaitan stated that the government has been following up on the nickel ore export which was recently suspended. According to him, export can be done, but it must be in accordance with applicable regulations and regulations. "Now his position (nickel ore export) is being sealed by Pak Bahlil (Head of BKPM), but approximately if all have met the provisions it will be released. Some of it is finished. Approximately so (already allowed to export). I do not know the details, Pak Bahlil will let me talk, "said Coordinating Minister Luhut when met by the media at the Maritime and Investment Office, Thursday (11/07/2019). When asked why under the authority of the Head of BKPM Bahlil Lahadalia, Menko Luhut stressed that" He is my representative in investment, "in short. For this problem, Coordinating Minister Luhut explained, his side also cooperates with the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK). This is in accordance with what was ordered by President Jokowi, in disciplining the investment process in Indonesia. "KPK, according to the President's order, we invite to discipline all the investment processes in Indonesia in number, as written by The Jakarta Post of approximately 80M more the numbers. So many investments are now ready, but hampered by various problems, sometimes hampered for up to 3-4 years. The President ordered me to finish it immediately, and I hope that it can be resolved soon, "he explained. In addition, the Coordinating Minister Luhut continued, it is also necessary Ministerial Regulation (Permen) from the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, revision needs to be done so that it does not conflict with the law. As for the revisions related to what is permitted and not permitted in exports. "I have reported the President, there were about 3-4 nickel players who already had derivatives to the bottom, we had a meeting for evaluation so that they could be integrated between one material such as nickel with copper concentrate, so have more added value for our country. Because for example, Freeport, we find the derivative, the derivative of copper concentrate can be 10-15 times added value. Earlier, I reported the President to create an integrated industry for that, "he said." Now it is already working, so we just have to see the smelter from Freeport not only in Gresik, but maybe later in Morowali or Weda Bay, so that Freeport will be safe. NTB then sent him to have up to 500 thousand tons of production there. So from the smelting later, the derivative products can be worked together. Besides that we also get a mother machine, it's a mother machine, which makes machine tools. Indonesia doesn't have it yet, we don't need to import any more machines, because we can make machines, maybe get to car engines, tools, etc., "he concluded.
